value.parameterDescription: The username to use when authenticating
The password to use when authenticating
The openstack tenant to take actions on behalf of
The openstack tenant to take actions on behalf of
The Openstack API version to use when making API calls
The endpoint URL for authenticating and running web service commands
The openstack region to use when interacting with the API
When set to true, this option will allow ViNO to connect to Openstack systems over insecure connections
(Optional) The number of times to retry asynchronous operations. Defaults to 5.
(Optional) The factor to use when employing an exponential backoff strategy. Defaults to 3
(Optional) The number of milliseconds to wait between retry attempts. Setting this value will disable the exponential backoff strategy.
(Optional) The minimum number of milliseconds to wait between retry attempts. This value will be used when employing an exponential backoff strategy. Defaults to 10 seconds (10,000 milliseconds).
(Optional) The maximum number of milliseconds to wait between retry attempts. This value will be used when employing an exponential backoff strategy. Defaults to 60 seconds (60,000 milliseconds).

value.name: Get Networks
value.description: Use to get a list of available Openstack networks.

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Get Network
value.description: Use to get the details of a specific network given a Network ID

inputParameters.parameterDescription: The identifier of the network to get detailed information about

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Create Network
value.description: Use to create an Openstack Network

inputParameters.parameterDescription: If present, the system will attempt to use this name as the name of the Network.  If the name already exists, the Network creation will fail
The administrative state of the network, which is up (true) or down (false). Defaults to false.
Indicates whether this resource is shared across all projects.  Defaults to false.

(Optional) The dns_domain of a network in conjunction with the dns_name attribute of its ports will be published in an external DNS service when Neutron is configured to integrate with such a service.

At the network level, port_security_enabled defines the default value for new ports attached to the network; they will inherit the value of their network’s port_security_enabled unless explicitly set on the port itself. Defaults to true.

(Optional) The ID of the project that owns the resource. Only administrative and users with advsvc role can specify a project ID other than their own. You cannot change this value through authorization policies.
The type of Network to create, as defined in Neutron"s NetworkType enum.
Name of the Network interface on the Host system.  How the Network is bound to a port in the host Virtual Machine system

(Optional depending on the Network Type) The ID of the isolated segment on the physical network. The network_type attribute defines the segmentation model. For example, if the network_type value is vlan, this ID is a vlan identifier. If the network_type value is gre, this ID is a gre key.
(Optional) The ID of the QoS policy associated with the network.
(Optional) Indicates whether the network has an external routing facility that’s not managed by the networking service.  Defaults to false
(Optional) Indicates the VLAN transparency mode of the network, which is VLAN transparent (true) or not VLAN transparent (false).
(Optional) A human-readable description for the resource. Default is an empty string.
(Optional) Indicates whether or not this network is the default network. Default value is false.
(Optional) The availability zone candidate for the network.

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The id of the Network that was created in Openstack
The name of the Network that was created in Openstack
The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Modify Network
value.description: Use to modify an Openstack Network

inputParameters.parameterDescription: The id of the Openstack Network to modify.
The system will attempt to use this name as the name of the Network.  If the name already exists, the Network creation will fail
(Optional) The administrative state of the network, which is up (true) or down (false).
(Optional) Indicates whether this resource is shared across all projects.

(Optional) The dns_domain of a network in conjunction with the dns_name attribute of its ports will be published in an external DNS service when Neutron is configured to integrate with such a service.

(Optional) At the network level, port_security_enabled defines the default value for new ports attached to the network; they will inherit the value of their network’s port_security_enabled unless explicitly set on the port itself.
(Optional) The type of Network to create, as defined in Neutron"s NetworkType enum.
(Optional) Name of the Network interface on the Host system.  How the Network is bound to a port in the host Virtual Machine system

(Optional) The ID of the isolated segment on the physical network. The network_type attribute defines the segmentation model. For example, if the network_type value is vlan, this ID is a vlan identifier. If the network_type value is gre, this ID is a gre key.
(Optional) The ID of the QoS policy associated with the network.
(Optional) Indicates whether the network has an external routing facility that’s not managed by the networking service.  Defaults to false
(Optional) A human-readable description for the resource. Default is an empty string.
(Optional) Indicates whether or not this network is the default network.

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The id of the Network that was created in Openstack
The name of the Network that was created in Openstack
The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Delete Network
value.description: Use to delete an Openstack Network

inputParameters.parameterDescription: The id of the Network to delete

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Get Subnets
value.description: Gets a list of available Openstack Subnets

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Get Subnet
value.description: Gets the details of a specified Openstack Subnet

inputParameters.parameterDescription: The ID of the Openstack Subnet to get detailed information on.

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Create Subnet
value.description: Use to create a generic Openstack Subnet

inputParameters.parameterDescription: (Optional) Human-readable name of the resource. Default is an empty string.

(Optional) The ID of the project that owns the resource. Only administrative and users with advsvc role can specify a project ID other than their own. You cannot change this value through authorization policies.
Boolean for whether or not DHCP is enabled on this Subnet.  Defaults to false
(Optional) List of dns name servers associated with the subnet. Default is an empty list.
The ID of the network to which the subnet belongs.
The CIDR to assign to this Subnet
The IP version to use when creating an address for this Subnet.  Defaults to 4

(Optional) Gateway IP of this subnet. If the value is null that implies no gateway is associated with the subnet. If the gateway_ip is not specified, OpenStack Networking allocates an address from the CIDR for the gateway for the subnet by default.
(Optional) A human-readable description for the resource. Default is an empty string.
(Optional) The prefix length to use for subnet allocation from a subnet pool. If not specified, the default_prefixlen value of the subnet pool will be used.
(Optional) The IPv6 address modes specifies mechanisms for assigning IP addresses. Value is slaac, dhcpv6-stateful, dhcpv6-stateless.
(Optional) The IPv6 router advertisement specifies whether the networking service should transmit ICMPv6 packets, for a subnet. Value is slaac, dhcpv6-stateful, dhcpv6-stateless.

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The identifier of the Subnet that was created in Openstack
The name of the Subnet that was created in Openstack
The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Modify Subnet
value.description: Use to create a generic Openstack Subnet

inputParameters.parameterDescription: The ID of the Openstack Subnet to modify.
(Optional) Human-readable name of the resource. Default is an empty string.
(Optional) Boolean for whether or not DHCP is enabled on this Subnet.
(Optional) List of dns name servers associated with the subnet. Default is an empty list.

(Optional) Gateway IP of this subnet. If the value is null that implies no gateway is associated with the subnet. If the gateway_ip is not specified, OpenStack Networking allocates an address from the CIDR for the gateway for the subnet by default.
(Optional) A human-readable description for the resource. Default is an empty string.

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The identifier of the Subnet that was created in Openstack
The name of the Subnet that was created in Openstack
The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Delete Subnet
value.description: Use to delete a generic Openstack Subnet

inputParameters.parameterDescription: The identifier of the Subnet to be deleted

value.description: Gets the details of a specified Openstack Port

inputParameters.parameterDescription: The ID of the Openstack Port to get detailed information on.

value.name: Create Port
value.description: Use to create an Openstack Network Port

inputParameters.parameterDescription: The name of the Port
(Optional) The administrative state of the resource, which is up (true) or down (false). Default is true.
(Optional) A human-readable description for the resource. Default is an empty string.
(Optional) The ID of the device that uses this port. For example, a server instance or a logical router.
(Optional) A set of Fixed IP addresses to assign to this port.
(Optional) The MAC address of the port. If unspecified, a MAC address is automatically generated.
The ID of the network that this port should be attached to.

(Optional) The port security status. A valid value is enabled (true) or disabled (false). If port security is enabled for the port, security group rules and anti-spoofing rules are applied to the traffic on the port. If disabled, no such rules are applied. If not set this value will default to the attached network"s settings.
(Optional) The IDs of security groups applied to the port.

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The identifier of the Port that was created in Openstack
The name of the Port that was created in Openstack
The address(es) of the Port that was created in Openstack. 0.0.0.0 will be returned as the only address if no assigned addresses are found.
The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Modify Port
value.description: Use to update an Openstack Network Port

inputParameters.parameterDescription: The ID of the port to modify
The name of the Port
(Optional) The administrative state of the resource, which is up (true) or down (false). Default is true.
(Optional) A human-readable description for the resource. Default is an empty string.
(Optional) The ID of the device that uses this port. For example, a server instance or a logical router.
(Optional) A set of Fixed IP addresses to assign to this port.
(Optional) The MAC address of the port. If unspecified, a MAC address is automatically generated.

(Optional) The port security status. A valid value is enabled (true) or disabled (false). If port security is enabled for the port, security group rules and anti-spoofing rules are applied to the traffic on the port. If disabled, no such rules are applied. If not set this value will default to the attached network"s settings.
(Optional) QoS policy associated with the port.
(Optional) The IDs of security groups applied to the port.

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Attach Port to VM
value.description: Use to attach a Port to a Device

inputParameters.parameterDescription: The ID of the port for which you want to create an interface. The net_id and port_id parameters are mutually exclusive. If you do not specify the port_id parameter, the OpenStack Networking API v2.0 allocates a port and creates an interface for it on the network.

The ID of the network for which you want to create a port interface. The net_id and port_id parameters are mutually exclusive. If you do not specify the net_id parameter, the OpenStack Networking API v2.0 uses the network information cache that is associated with the instance.
The UUID of the server to attach an interface to.

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String
The id of the port that was attached to the VM. This is useful when attaching a network directly.
The ip address of the port that was attached. This may be 0.0.0.0 in the case the port has no address.

value.name: Get Virtual Machines
value.description: Use to get a list of Openstack Virtual Machines

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Get Virtual Machine
value.description: Use to get the details of a specific Openstack Virtual Machine.

inputParameters.parameterDescription: The ID of the virtual machine you wish to query for details about.

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Create Virtual Machine
value.description: Use to create an Openstack Virtual Machine.

inputParameters.parameterDescription: The name to assign the Openstack Virtual Machine.
The name of the Openstack SSH Key to inject into the VM. Note: This key must be installed on the openstack cluster.

(Optional) A list of the IDs for networks that should be bound to this Openstack VM Instance. If Management Network Type is 'network', the management network ID may be included in this list to control the order in which it is added to the Virtual Machine relative to other networks.

(Optional) A list of the IDs for ports that should be bound to this Openstack VM Instance. If Management Network Type is 'port', the management port ID may be included in this list to control the order in which it is added to the Virtual Machine relative to other ports.

The ID of the port or network that should be bound to this Openstack VM Instance and used as the management connection. Including this ID in the Network IDs parameter provides control over what order this network/port is added to the Virtual Machine relative to other networks and ports.

The type of ID that was passed as the Management Interface ID. "none" should only be used when management of the VM will be done out of band. This option will set the Management IP Address output parameter to '0.0.0.0' and will prevent the use of that output parameter for accessing the VM in future steps.

inputParameters.parameterName: Use Floating IP Address For Management Network
inputParameters.parameterDescription: Boolean indicating whether a Floating IP address should be reserved for and applied to the management network for the Openstack VM Instance.
(Optional - Required if using floating IPs) The Floating IP Address Pool to use when reserving Floating IP Addresses.
The flavor to use when creating the Openstack VM Instance.
The image to use when creating the Openstack VM Instance.
(optional) Configuration information or scripts to use upon launch. Restricted to 65535 bytes.
(Optional) Schedule the server on a host in the network specified with this parameter and a cidr (os:scheduler_hints.cidr). It is available when SimpleCIDRAffinityFilter is available on cloud side.

(Optional) Schedule the server on a host in the network specified with an IP address (os:scheduler_hints:build_near_host_ip) and this parameter. If os:scheduler_hints:build_near_host_ip is specified and this parameter is omitted, /24 is used. It is available when SimpleCIDRAffinityFilter is available on cloud side.

(Optional) A list of cell routes or a cell route (string). Schedule the server in a cell that is not specified. It is available when DifferentCellFilter is available on cloud side that is cell v1 environment.
(Optional) A list of server UUIDs or a server UUID. Schedule the server on a different host from a set of servers. It is available when DifferentHostFilter is available on cloud side.

(Optional) The server group UUID. Schedule the server according to a policy of the server group (anti-affinity, affinity, soft-anti-affinity or soft-affinity). It is available when ServerGroupAffinityFilter, ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter, ServerGroupSoftAntiAffinityWeigher, ServerGroupSoftAffinityWeigher are available on cloud side.

(Optional) Schedule the server by using a custom filter in JSON format. For example:

"query": "[\">=\",\"$free_ram_mb\",1024]"
It is available when JsonFilter is available on cloud side.
(Optional) A list of server UUIDs or a server UUID. Schedule the server on the same host as another server in a set of servers. It is available when SameHostFilter is available on cloud side.
(Optional) A target cell name. Schedule the server in a host in the cell specified. It is available when TargetCellFilter is available on cloud side that is cell v1 environment.

(Optional) Defines the order in which a hypervisor tries devices when it attempts to boot the guest from storage. Give each device a unique boot index starting from 0. To disable a device from booting, set the boot index to a negative value or use the default boot index value, which is None. The simplest usage is, set the boot index of the boot device to 0 and use the default boot index value, None, for any other devices. Some hypervisors might not support booting from multiple devices; these hypervisors consider only the device with a boot index of 0. Some hypervisors support booting from multiple devices but only if the devices are of different types. For example, a disk and CD-ROM.

inputParameters.parameterName: Block Device Mapping Delete on Termination
inputParameters.parameterDescription: (Optional) To delete the boot volume when the server is destroyed, specify true. Otherwise, specify false. Default: false

(Optional) The source type of the block device. Valid values are:

blank: Depending on the destination_type and guest_format, this will either be a blank persistent volume or an ephemeral (or swap) disk local to the compute host on which the server resides
image: This is only valid with destination_type=volume; creates an image-backed volume in the block storage service and attaches it to the server
snapshot: This is only valid with destination_type=volume; creates a volume backed by the given volume snapshot referenced via the block_device_mapping_v2.uuid parameter and attaches it to the server
volume: This is only valid with destination_type=volume; uses the existing persistent volume referenced via the block_device_mapping_v2.uuid parameter and attaches it to the server
This parameter is required unless block_device_mapping_v2.no_device is specified.

See Block Device Mapping in Nova for more details on valid source and destination types.

(Optional) Defines where the block device mapping will reside. Valid values are:

local: The ephemeral disk resides local to the compute host on which the server runs
volume: The persistent volume is stored in the block storage service

(Optional) A path to the device for the volume that you want to use to boot the server. Note that as of the 12.0.0 Liberty release, the Nova libvirt driver no longer honors a user-supplied device name. This is the same behavior as if the device name parameter is not supplied on the request.
(Optional) The device type. For example, disk, cdrom.

(Optional) Disk bus type, some hypervisors (currently only libvirt) support specify this parameter. Some example disk_bus values can be: ide, usb, virtio, scsi. This is not an exhaustive list as it depends on the virtualization driver, and may change as more support is added.

(Optional) Specifies the guest server disk file system format, such as ext2, ext3, ext4, xfs or swap.

Swap block device mappings have the following restrictions:

The source_type must be blank
The destination_type must be local
There can only be one swap disk per server
The size of the swap disk must be less than or equal to the swap size of the flavor

(Optional) This is the uuid of source resource. The uuid points to different resources based on the source_type. For example, if source_type is image, the block device is created based on the specified image which is retrieved from the image service. Similarly, if source_type is snapshot then the uuid refers to a volume snapshot in the block storage service. If source_type is volume then the uuid refers to a volume in the block storage service.

(Optional) The size of the volume (in GiB). This is integer value from range 1 to 2147483647 which can be requested as integer and string. This parameter must be specified in the following cases:

An image to volume case
block_device_mapping_v2.source_type is image
block_device_mapping_v2.destination_type is volume
A blank to volume case
block_device_mapping_v2.source_type is blank
block_device_mapping_v2.destination_type is volume

outputParameters.parameterDescription: The ID of the virtual machine which was created.
The ID of the virtual machine which was created.
The raw response from the Openstack API. JSON formatted String

value.name: Get Projects

value.name: Get Project
